short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Uses the devtools API to add a sidebar that displays the Knockout data associated with the selected DOM element.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
KnockoutJS Scanner

If you're working with Knockout.js, a popular JavaScript library for building responsive displays, our KnockoutJS Scanner extension will become a valuable addition to your toolkit.

This extension is designed to help you better understand and debug your Knockout.js applications by providing real-time insights into your view model data and context directly within Google Chrome's DevTools.

Key Features

Live Data Visualization

Once you install this extension, a new sidebar pane titled 'KnockoutJS Context' will appear within the Elements panel of your Chrome DevTools. When you select any element in the Elements panel, the KnockoutJS Context sidebar will instantly display the surrounding view model data and context related to that specific element in your Knockout.js application.
This eliminates the need to manually retrieve and log model data, thus speeding up your workflow and helping you locate and fix issues quickly.

Why Should You Install the KnockoutJS Scanner?

Improved Debugging Efficiency
With KnockoutJS Scanner, get immediate access to the data and context of your Knockout.js view models, speeding up your debugging process and providing a more efficient workflow.

Ease of Use
There is no additional setup required after installation. Just install the extension, open DevTools, navigate to your application, and start exploring!

Better Understanding
By having the ability to explore your data models, application state, and Knockout.js context in real time in a comfortable sidebar format, you can achieve a deeper understanding of your application.


Note
Remember, KnockoutJS Scanner only works with applications that use the Knockout.js library for data binding. Make sure your app utilizes Knockout.js before installation.

Improve your productivity and understanding of your Knockout.js applications by installing the KnockoutJS Scanner today!
